definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
to waste time on worthless activities

sentences.english: Each moment is a gift so do not waste this gift by feeling sorry for yourself or anxious.
sentences.chinese: 每一刻都是生命的赐予，不要因焦虑而虚度光阴。

sentences.english: Frank: Any minute? Some people live a lifetime in a minute. What are you doing right now?
sentences.chinese: 随时？有些人为了这个虚度一生。你现在做什么呢？

sentences.english: Hell, in the past few years you’ve been all but killed about a million times.
sentences.chinese: 该死，在过去的几年里你除了虚度光阴以外一事无成。

sentences.english: You are loafing away your precious time!
The time of life is short ; to spend that shortness basely, it would be too long.
sentences.chinese: 人生苦短，若虚度年华，则短暂的人生就太长了。

sentences.english: Abuse of youth, is better than lost youth.
sentences.chinese: 滥用青春，胜于虚度青春。

sentences.english: Idling aways one'slife is like paying gold but buying nothing.
sentences.chinese: 若把一生的光阴虚度，便是抛下黄金未买一物。

sentences.english: All about dream efforts, will make people feel shame to idle away one's time.
sentences.chinese: 所有关于梦想的努力，都会让虚度年华的人感到羞耻。

sentences.english: Xiao Qiu was filled with remorse over the wasted time.
sentences.chinese: 小邱因虚度光阴而懊悔。

sentences.english: Some people go through life standing at the excuse counter.
sentences.chinese: 有些人站在“借口”这一柜台后虚度一生。

sentences.english: The young man played away his youth.
sentences.chinese: 这个年轻人虚度了青春。

sentences.english: I im the star in the northern sky.
sentences.chinese: 在北部空中云集成小星虚度。

sentences.english: The teacher told the students not to  loiter their time away.
sentences.chinese: 老师告诉学生不要虚度光阴。

sentences.english: The time of life is short ; to spend that shortness basely, it would be too long .
sentences.chinese: 人生苦短，若虚度年华，则短暂的人生就太长了。

sentences.english: Don't loiter ; keep moving ; it may rain to-morrow.
sentences.chinese: 别虚度光阴，勇往直前，就算明天会下雨。

sentences.english: For you, my youth is wasted.

definition: to waste time on worthless activities
(literary) to slip/(of looks etc) to fade away/(of time) to slip away/to squander (time, opportunities)/to dillydally
to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
to have achieved nothing/to be a total failure/to get nowhere
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
